page.title: 05THE RIVER WELLAND
page.content: The River Welland runs slowly through our area from Crowland to Spalding,with its original source in Northamptonshire and its mouth flows into the Wash.At Cowbit the Welland is 30m wide and 5m deep. The main use of the Welland is for land drainage as in 1947 Cowbit Wash flooded,thus the present Barrier Bank .Fishing is also a major attraction.The present rod licence is Â£1.50. The local yacht club uses this section of the river and anyone taking a motorised boat on the river needs a licence. Irrigation is also a main facility of the Welland and the river banks are an important conservation area.With the Welland being so clean it is the home for a great variety of wild life.
